meanings.definition: A box used for storing or transporting cakes.
meanings.sent1: I placed the freshly baked cake in the cakebox to keep it safe.
meanings.sent2: The bakery sold a beautiful cake in a lovely cakebox.
meanings.sent3: The cakebox was so big, it could fit a giant cake inside!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a cakebox, always ready to hold happiness.
meanings.sent5: The cakebox, with its bright colors, stood out among the other boxes.

meanings.definition: A box designed to hold a single cake.
meanings.sent1: Mom bought a special cakebox for my birthday cake.
meanings.sent2: The small cakebox was perfect for the tiny cake.
meanings.sent3: The cakebox looked like a tiny house for the cake.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt like a cakebox, protecting his love for her.
meanings.sent5: The cakebox, with its ribbon tied neatly, was a gift in itself.

meanings.definition: A box used for packaging cakes for sale.
meanings.sent1: The bakery used a clear cakebox to display the cakes.
meanings.sent2: Each cakebox was labeled with the flavor of the cake inside.
meanings.sent3: The cakebox wore a tiny bow tie to impress the customers.
meanings.sent4: The cakebox whispered secrets of delicious treats to come.
meanings.sent5: The cakebox, with its window showing the cake, enticed customers to buy.
